pullRequest.body:
Renames `Polynomial.frange` to `Polynomial.coeffs`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: Can you motivate this renaming by comparing with other parts of the library? Or is it simply a personal preference?

> Can you motivate this renaming by comparing with other parts of the library? Or is it simply a personal preference?

I find `coeffs` more telling than `frange` and it was suggested here:
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Ring.20of.20definition/near/437593971

> > Can you motivate this renaming by comparing with other parts of the library? Or is it simply a personal preference?
> 
> I find `coeffs` more telling than `frange` and it was suggested here: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Ring.20of.20definition/near/437593971

Oh perfect, I had not followed that chat. Great, then!

@chrisflav Could you please add a `deprecated alias` for the old names? (And please use the new `since` feature of `deprecated`.
So something like
```
@[deprecated (since := "2024-05-07")] alias zpow_ne_zero_of_ne_zero := zpow_ne_zero
```

Otherwise, LGTM. And thanks for doing this.

bors d+

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.
